level.text: Acids or other corrosive substances may be used for cleaning windows only under the conditions set forth in this section.
If the scaffold that is used is of the swinging type, it shall be suspended by a wire rope.
The use of a fiber rope of any kind is prohibited.
A highly dilute solution that is not more than five percent (5%) hydrochloric (muriaic) acid shall be used.
The cleaner shall wear rubber gloves and shall apply the solution with a brush.
All parts of the scaffolding and other equipment shall be liberally washed with water after each use to prevent corrosive reactions.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Section 11-2514, effective September 1, 1958, ch. 25, 5 DCR 28 (August 11, 1958); 11B DCRR, Special Edition.
